decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Amulet of Vigor, allowing you to play powerful threats like Primeval Titan early on. The deck revolves around the synergy between lands that produce multiple mana (such as bounce lands) and cards that untap them (such as Amulet of Vigor) to generate massive mana advantage. This enables you to tutor for key lands or threats with cards like Tolaria West and Trinket Mage, ultimately setting up explosive turns to overwhelm your opponent and secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and aggressively burn down the opponent's life total using burn spells and aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze helps to punish opponents for playing spells or having creatures on the board. With a low mana curve and efficient removal, this deck aims to relentlessly apply pressure and win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. This is done through a combination of efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game as quickly as possible, often winning before the opponent has a chance to fully set up their game plan.

The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, dealing consistent damage to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By efficiently utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide, along with powerful burn spells such as Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, the deck can rapidly close out games before the opponent is able to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Boros Charm and Lightning Helix provides additional reach and flexibility in both dealing damage to the opponent and protecting the player's own life total.

This Dredge combo deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with creature cards by utilizing cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Faithless Looting, in order to bring back powerful threats like Vengevine and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The deck also includes cards like Bloodghast and Gravecrawler that can easily be recurred from the graveyard, creating a constant stream of threats for the opponent to deal with. With the ability to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a board full of creatures, this deck aims to win the game in the early turns through aggressive graveyard synergy.

This deck revolves around playing aggressive creatures and disrupting your opponent's game plan with hand disruption and removal spells. By efficiently controlling the board and applying pressure with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can set up their own game plan. The deck also utilizes powerful Planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six to generate advantage and grind out longer games. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to the deck's powerful spells while minimizing potential drawbacks.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Monastery Mentor and Seasoned Pyromancer, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck can also grind out long games with cards like Lingering Souls and Smiting Helix. Worship provides protection against board wipes, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive stance. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression, disruption, and resilience.

The focus of this deck is to quickly cast spells that deal damage and generate card advantage to bring out Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for aggressive attacks. Aggressive creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear are used to deal early damage, while spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike help to close out the game. The efficiency of cheap cantrips like Manamorphose and Faithless Looting allows for consistent card draw and the ability to cast multiple spells in a turn to trigger Arclight Phoenix.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly play low-cost spells and creatures to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. By using cards like Faithless Looting, Light Up the Stage, and Manamorphose, the deck aims to turbo out Arclight Phoenix and other aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear. With burn spells like Lava Spike, Lightning Bolt, and Lava Dart, the deck can deal direct damage to the opponent while also enabling the recursion of Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. Overall, this deck is focused on applying pressure and closing out the game quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize mill cards such as Archive Trap and Glimpse the Unthinkable to quickly deplete the opponent's library, while also utilizing cards like Mesmeric Orb and Hedron Crab to accelerate the milling process. Additionally, the deck includes control elements such as Ensnaring Bridge and Fatal Push to manage the opponent's creatures and maintain board control. The inclusion of cards like Surgical Extraction and Crypt Incursion allows for disruption of the opponent's strategy, while Mission Briefing provides flexibility in reusing key spells. Ultimately, the goal is to mill the opponent out as quickly and efficiently as possible.

This deck is focused on quickly generating mana and using spells like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual, along with cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer, to cast multiple spells in a turn to eventually win with a high storm count and finisher like Grapeshot or Empty the Warrens. The deck also includes cantrips like Serum Visions and Opt to help filter through the deck and find combo pieces, with Gifts Ungiven acting as a versatile toolbox to set up the combo. The goal is to efficiently cycle through the deck and storm off for a lethal finish.

The primary focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) in order to generate large amounts of mana and play powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin the Spirit Dragon, Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, and Ulamog the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes cards like Expedition Map, Sylvan Scrying, and Ancient Stirrings to help find the UrzaTron lands quickly. In addition, there are cards like Ghost Quarter, Blast Zone, and Oblivion Stone for removal and disruption, making it a strong control deck with a late-game win condition.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful colorless spells like Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes control elements like Oblivion Stone and Karn Liberated to deal with threats, while also utilizing cards like Chromatic Star and Relic of Progenitus for card advantage and graveyard hate. The overall strategy is to control the game while ramping into big threats and overwhelming the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by ramping up mana with UrzaTron lands to play powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Relic of Progenitus and Oblivion Stone. Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon provide additional removal and threats. The deck aims to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent's resources to secure victory in the late game.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) as quickly as possible to generate a large amount of mana. This mana is used to cast powerful colorless threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck utilizes control elements such as Relic of Progenitus and Oblivion Stone to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also including game-ending planeswalkers like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through efficient plays and powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to have control over the game by disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Damnation. It also focuses on controlling the board with Ensnaring Bridge and finishes off opponents with cards like Syphon Life and Vendilion Clique. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Snapcaster Mage to gain advantage. Additionally, it has various land destruction and graveyard hate cards to further control the opponent's options.
